name: Hikma Health Inc
mission: We partner with nonprofit organizations providing healthcare in underserved and refugee populations. We create customized data systems for these healthc...
theoryOfChange: Hikma Health explicitly states they are "using an implementation science framework to understand the real-world application of our system across a variety of clinical and cultural settings." They are conducting a feasibility study and an effectiveness trial with partners globally to investigate the barriers and facilitators to implementing their system. Additionally, their Health & Environmental Record System (HERS) provides data analytics and modeling tools to empower data-driven decision-making at individual, clinic, population, and environmental levels, aiding in planning and policy decisions to improve public health.

grantsData.purpose: Grant to Parkers Mobile Clinic, a non profit in Nigeria providing healthcare services to deploy the Hikma Health EHR system.

zakatClaimEvidence: No explicit mention of "zakat" or "zakat donations" was found on the official website or donation pages of Hikma Health, a US-based 501(c)(3) charitable organization. The donation page details general contributions and tax deductibility but does not refer to zakat.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work

alignment.rationale: Alignment 31/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

score_details.score_summary: HIKMA HEALTH INC shows strong impact and good alignment. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: No explicit mention of "zakat" or "zakat donations" was found on the official website or donation pages of Hikma Health, a US-based 501(c)(3) charitable organization. The donation page details general contributions and tax deductibility but does not refer to zakat.

all_citations.claim: Hikma Health partners with nonprofits to provide customized data systems for underserved and refugee populations.
The organization reported total revenue of $70,494, a 100.0% program expense ratio, 26.0 months of working capital, and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The organization accepts general donations and sadaqah to support its health technology deployments.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization achieves a solid score of 72/100 due to its high impact directness and perfect program expense ratio, though its overall alignment is moderated by its specialized niche.
areas_for_improvement: Relatively small revenue base may limit the scale of global deployments
Limited public documentation regarding long-term systemic outcome tracking

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization addresses the urgent global health needs of refugee populations, representing a medium fit for donors seeking to support technology-driven sadaqah initiatives [1][3]. While it provides critical infrastructure for underserved communities, its specific focus on data systems offers a specialized pathway for charitable giving [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates high impact through systemic change, utilizing its $70,494 in revenue to support programs like the Health and Environmental Record System (HERS) and the Latin America Deployment [1][2]. Its financial health is robust, characterized by 26.0 months of working capital and a 100.0% program expense ratio [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Hikma Health Inc. empowers nonprofit healthcare providers in underserved regions through customized data systems and innovative health technology.
strengths: Maintains a 100.0% program expense ratio, directing all resources to service delivery
Exceptional fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 26.0 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Hikma Health Inc. partners with organizations serving refugee and vulnerable populations to implement customized digital health solutions [1]. The organization reported a total revenue of $70,494 and maintains a program expense ratio of 100.0%, ensuring all funds are directed toward its core health initiatives [2].
